docs.title: nopAccelerate Plus Pro
docs.text:
nopAccelerate Plus Pro helps businesses across the nopCommerce ecosystem create highly relevant, scalable, and lightning-fast in-site search and product discovery experiences.

It is one of the Best Rich Search Plugins for nopCommerce stores. It integrates Apache Solr with nopCommerce to deliver outstanding features that enhance in-site product search.

nopAccelerate Plus Pro brings powerful search technology that strengthens your eCommerce store search, ultimately improving user experience and driving customer satisfaction.

docs.title: Why nopAccelerate Plus Pro?
docs.text:
• Better and faster search results directly and positively impact sales.
  • Better Search = More Revenue!
  • nopAccelerate Plus Pro is completely different from the original nopAccelerate. Since 2013–14, nopCommerce has evolved significantly, allowing us to design an advanced, modern, and standard integration plugin.
  • The product is now more compatible with themes and plugins, easier to extend, and simpler to maintain.
  • It includes Search & Facets features, making it more powerful than nopAccelerate Plus Search.

docs.title: Core Features
docs.text:
1. DIH (Data Import Handler) indexing process for faster indexing.
  2. Reload Solr core directly from the admin panel.
  3. Automatic core setup (managed schema, DIH request, update dbConfig, schema management).
  4. Clear core data from the nopAccelerate Plus Pro admin panel.
  5. Execute Solr queries from the admin panel.
  6. Automatic indexing on entity change via a simple toggle setting.
  7. Direct DB update support with automatic incremental table update.
  8. Basic configuration panel integrated into nopCommerce admin.
  9. Single core for multi-language & multi-store.
  10. API integration support.
  11. Advanced wizard for Solr setup & product integration.
  12. Easy-to-follow product basics and admin settings tour.
  13. Zero theme customization required.
  14. Supports 36 languages out of the box.
  15. Fully compatible with NopTemplates themes.

docs.title: Search Features
docs.text:
1. Replaces default nopCommerce search.
  2. Extensive configuration options for search relevancy.
  3. Advanced language analysis during search.
  4. Search across Meta Title, Description & Keywords.
  5. Auto spell suggestions.
  6. Sorting options in search results.
  7. Infinite scrolling and pagination options.
  8. Fine-tuning search using Minimum Should Match.
  9. Highly relevant and advanced search functionality.
  10. Advanced autocomplete search with greater relevancy.

docs.title: Catalog Features
docs.text:
1. Product navigation from Apache Solr.
  2. Layered / Faceted navigation.
  3. Enhanced Category, Manufacturer & Tag pages via Solr.
  4. Configurable catalog listing options.
  5. Stay online during first-time full indexing.
  6. Support for default filters.
  7. Category page filters.
  8. Manufacturer page filters.
  9. Product Tag page filters.
  10. jQuery slider-based price range filter.
  11. Multi-select faceting.
  12. Enhanced faceting UI.
  13. Instant AJAX faceting.
  14. AJAX response caching.
  15. Solr request caching.
  16. Stock availability filter.
  17. Rating-based sorting.
  18. Mobile-responsive filters.
  19. Infinite scrolling on all catalog pages.
  20. State-aware URLs using HTML5 History API.

docs.title: Facet Features
docs.text:
1. Price Range and Price Slot facet filters.
  2. Category, Manufacturer, Vendor & Product Tag facet filters.
  3. Product Attribute & Specification Attribute facet filters.
  4. Stock Availability filter.
  5. Product Rating facet filter.
  6. Instant AJAX faceting.
  7. Search within facet results.
  8. View More / View Less functionality for long facet lists.
  9. Default expanded or collapsed facet settings on page load.

docs.title: Category and Manufacturer Navigation not working
Question
docs.text: Category and Manufacturer Navigation are not working on our store.

docs.title: Cause of the Problem
docs.text:
The currentCategoryId parameter used to invoke the CategoryNavigation ViewComponent is always 0 when using nopAccelerate Plus.

This happens because the controller name is not catalog anymore — nopAccelerate Plus overrides the default Catalog controller.

As a result, the navigation components do not receive the correct category context.

docs.title: Solution
docs.text: You need to update the controller reference in your NopCommerce theme file.

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Open the file: _ColumnsTwo.cshtml

  2. Replace the controller name with NopAcceleratePlusWebCatalog This will correctly load CategoryNavigation and Manufacturer Navigation while using the nopAccelerate Catalog Plugin.

docs.title: How can I connect to Solr?
Question
docs.text: How can I connect to Solr? It shows a connection issue.

docs.title: Solution
docs.text: First, verify that your Solr Core URL is correct.

docs.title: Example
docs.text: If your Solr core name is Solr_sample, then your Solr Core URL should be: http://localhost:8983/solr/Solr_sample

docs.title: Make Sure:
docs.text:
• Your Solr Core URL does not end with a / Correct: http://localhost:8983/solr/Solr_sample Incorrect: http://localhost:8983/solr/Solr_sample/

  • Remove # from the Solr Core URL if it exists.

docs.title: Error while performing indexing using DataImportHandler
Question
docs.text:
You receive the following error when trying to index data using DataImportHandler:

com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The TCP/IP connection to the host localhost, port 1433 has failed. Error: "Connection refused: connect. Verify the connection properties. Make sure that an instance of SQL Server is running on the host and accepting TCP/IP connections at the port. Make sure that TCP connections to the port are not blocked by a firewall."

docs.title: Solution
docs.text: Follow the steps below to resolve this issue:

docs.title: 1. Open SQL Server Configuration Manager
docs.text: Press Windows Key + R to open the Run dialog.

docs.title: 2. Run the Configuration Manager for your SQL Server version
docs.text:
Use the appropriate command:

  • SQLServerManager15.msc → SQL Server 2018
  • SQLServerManager14.msc → SQL Server 2017
  • SQLServerManager13.msc → SQL Server 2016
  • SQLServerManager12.msc → SQL Server 2014
  • SQLServerManager11.msc → SQL Server 2012
  • SQLServerManager10.msc → SQL Server 2008

Note: If SQL Configuration Manager is not found, verify your SQL Server installation.

docs.title: 4. Enable TCP/IP
docs.text: Right-click TCP/IP → select Enable.

docs.title: 5. Restart SQL Server Services
docs.text: Restart the SQL service so changes take effect.

docs.title: JAVA Setup
docs.text: To set up SOLR and nopAccelerate Plus on your machine, the first step is to install and configure Java. Follow the steps below:

docs.title: 1. Download and Install Java
docs.text:
Download JAVA Latest Version from here.

Install the latest Java version. You may choose the version as per your system requirements, but we recommend using the Windows Offline (64-bit) installer.

After successful installation, you can check the Java installation path:

  • For Windows 32-bit: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java

  • For Windows 64-bit: C:\Program Files\Java

docs.title: 2. Define the JAVA_HOME Environment Variable
docs.text: Defining the JAVA_HOME variable helps SOLR locate the Java installation on your machine.

docs.title: a) Open Environment Variable Settings
docs.text:
Do one of the following:

  • Windows 7: Right-click My Computer → Properties → Advanced System Settings

  • Windows 8: Control Panel → System → Advanced System Settings

  • Windows 10 / 11: Search for Environment Variables → Select Edit the system environment variables

docs.title: b) Click the Environment Variables button.
c) Under System Variables, click New.
d) Add the JAVA_HOME Variable
docs.text:
• Variable Name: JAVA_HOME

  • Variable Value: Add your Java installation path, for example: C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.8.0_201

docs.title: JAVA Setup
docs.text:
Click OK. You will now see the newly added JAVA_HOME variable in the environment variables list.

You have successfully configured the Java environment variable.

docs.title: SOLR Setup
docs.text: To set up SOLR on your machine, follow the steps below:

docs.title: 1. Download Solr
docs.text:
Go to this link and download Solr 8.11.0 or above:

👉 Download Solr

Select the preferred file. We recommend downloading Solr 8.11.0 version.

We are assuming you are installing this on Windows.

Note: The solr-version.zip or solr-version.tgz files (where version is the version number, e.g., 7.5.0) contain: - Apache Solr - HTML documentation - Solr tutorial

docs.title: 2. Copy Downloaded Solr Version
docs.text:
Extract the downloaded file to a preferred location.

We assume you extracted it to the C:\ drive and named the folder Solr. So your Solr path becomes:

docs.title: Solr Setup Steps
docs.text: Hence, Solr is downloaded and Java is set up. Now let's start Solr.

docs.title: Setup core if your Solr is hosted on a shared server
docs.text: If you are using a Shared Server for Solr, you need to perform additional setup steps for the Solr Core.

docs.title: 1. Configure Solr Core URL
docs.text:
• Enter the remote Solr server URL in the Solr Core URL field.
  • Save the configuration page.

docs.title: 2. Run Core Setup
docs.text:
• Click Core Setup.
  • It may take some time.
  • After completion:
  • ✔ Managed Schema
  • ✔ Core Stream Body
  • ✔ Pattern Handler
  • ❌ DB Config File
  • ❌ Request Handler
  • The red cross icons indicate some manual setup is required.

docs.title: Manual Setup Steps for Remote Solr Hosting
1. Download required setup files
docs.text:
• Go to: nopAccelerate Plus → nopAccelerate+ Search → Configure
  • Find Setup files download
  • Click the download button to get a ZIP containing required files.

docs.title: 2. Copy configuration files
docs.text:
Unzip the file — you will find 3 files:

  • db-data-config.xml
  • solrconfig.xml
  • synonyms.txt

Copy these files into the conf folder of your Solr data directory.

After copying, Reload the Core from Solr Admin.

docs.title: 3. Install Microsoft JDBC Driver
docs.text:
Solr needs the MS SQL JDBC driver to connect to SQL Server.

  • Copy the file: sqljdbc42.jar
  • Paste it into Solr’s dataimporthandler/lib folder.

Example (Windows): C:\solr-7.5.0\contrib\dataimporthandler\lib

Create the folder if it does not exist.

docs.title: 4. Reload Core from nopAccelerate
docs.text:
• Go back to the plugin Configure page.
  • Click Reload to apply all manual changes.

docs.title: 5. Verify Core Setup
docs.text:
Return to Core Setup: - This time the Request Handler should show ✔ correctly done. - Manually update DbConfigFileStatus to true. - Perform Indexing.

If indexing works successfully, your remote Solr core setup is complete.

docs.title: TimeOut Expiration Error on Plugin installation
Question
docs.text:
I am getting the following error while installing the plugin:

Timeout expired. The timeout period elapsed prior to completion of the operation or the server is not responding

docs.title: Cause of the Problem
docs.text:
This issue occurs when there is a large amount of data, and during plugin installation the system attempts to create the Incremental_Table.

While doing so, the stored procedure:

NopAcc_Plus_ManageIncrementalSolrProductTable

takes too long to execute and results in a timeout.

docs.title: Solution
docs.text:
Follow the steps below:

  1. Open the file: Plugin > NopAcceleratePlus.Search > SqlScript > Sp_SolrInstall.sql

  2. Remove the following line from the script:

EXEC NopAcc_Plus_ManageIncrementalSolrProductTable

  1. Manually execute the stored procedure directly in SQL Server:

  2. After the stored procedure completes successfully, install the plugin again.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Bundled Discounts Plug-in for nopCommerce enables the store owner to boost sales by offering discounts when customers purchase additional products along with the one they originally intend to buy.

The store owner can create bundle(s) on a base product and set a discount amount that applies when the bundle is purchased.

They can add discounts for bundles and link additional products to the base product within each bundle. The customer will receive the configured discount when buying that bundle.

Customers can view bundle offers on the product details page of the base product. They can directly add bundle products to the cart from this page. If any bundle product has attributes, the plug-in will display a pop-up window for attribute selection.

docs.title: Features
docs.text: Features Enable/Disable Plug-in functionality. Enable/Disable dropping bundle related tables when un-installing the plug-in. Multi-store supported. Multi-currency supported. Create and manage various bundles and set bundle title as well as bundle name. Enable/Disable bundle and apply discount on bundle. Add bundle products to cart from bundle. Easy navigation to additional products. Auto update/delete of bundle discount on updating/deleting bundled product from the cart. Discount amount can or cannot be in percentage of bundle subtotal amount. Position your bundles' list on the basis of selected widget zone. Supported nopCommerce versions 3.70, 3.80, 3.90 and 4.00.

docs.title: General Tab Configuration
docs.text:
This plug-in displays reward points on the product detail page that a customer would earn based on the product amount and the configured reward point settings.

⚠️ Note: The plug-in will not work if reward points settings are disabled in nopCommerce. To enable reward point settings, go to: Configuration → Settings → Reward Points and enable it along with other reward point configurations.

docs.title: Display Configuration
docs.text:
• You can choose where to display reward points for the product amount using "CSS selector for Reward points". Reward points will appear after the element defined by your selector.

  • You can customize the HTML content with inline CSS styles in the "Display content" text box as per your preference.

💡 Important: It is mandatory to include the keyword RewardPoints in your text where you want the calculated reward points to appear. Without RewardPoints, only static text will be displayed on the product details page (no reward points will be shown).

docs.text:
If you face any issues, you can:

You can also send us the exact steps to reproduce the issue by recording it using the Problem Steps Recorder (psr.exe) on Windows:

  1. Open Run in Windows and type psr.exe, then press Enter.
  2. Click Start Record and perform the steps that produce the issue.
  3. When done, click Stop Record.
  4. You will be prompted to save a .zip file.
  5. Email the saved .zip file to us along with a short description of the issue.
